cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CY. 

The paper deals with secret sharing, which is a fundamental concept in cryptography and information theory. The paper also mentions linear codes, which are closely related to secret sharing schemes. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves the study of access structures, which are related to combinatorial designs and graph theory, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also mentions complexity bounds, which are related to computational complexity theory, making cs.CC (Computational Complexity) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the study of ideal secret sharing schemes, which are related to algebraic geometry and coding theory, making cs.CY (Cryptography and Security) a possible sub-category.
